event.headline: See the twisted new love story before anyone else
event.description: COMPANION is a new kind of love story from the unhinged creators of BARBARIAN, so it goes without saying that you can expect a twist or two. If you’d rather not risk getting spoiled on some of the wildest turns we’ve seen in a good long while, then don’t miss our exclusive COMPANION Advance Screening. It’s got all the thrills and chills genre fiends crave and gets two big thumbs up from our friends at Fantastic Fest.

show.title: Groundhog Day
show.headline: He's having the worst day of his life...over and over again

event.title: <show-title>Groundhog Day</show-title> <event-type-title>Feast</event-type-title>
event.headline: Have the best meal of your life...over and over again
event.description:
Well, it's Groundhog Day...again. Join us and enjoy a special three-course prix fixe menu with themed dishes and a delightful drink.

Start things off with I Got You Pavé: thinly sliced russet potatoes covered in cream and roasted with cheese, fresh herbs, and caramelized onions. Next up is No Tomorrow Lasagna: layers of pasta with garlic-roasted mushrooms, mozzarella cheese, and a rich Parmesan sauce. Finish up with a decadent dessert we like to call Chocolate Never Gets Old: white chocolate custard, sliced strawberries, and shaved dark chocolate between sheets of puff pastry.

I Got You Pavé

Thin sliced russet potatoes covered in cream, roasted with fancy cheese, fresh picked herbs & caramelized onions, garnished with olive oil & fried spinach

No Tomorrow Lasagna

Pasta sheets layered with garlic-roasted mushrooms, mozzarella & rich parmesan sauce, garnished with fried basil leaves

Chocolate Never Gets Old

White chocolate custard, strawberries & shaved dark chocolate layered between sheets of puff pastry, garnished with fried mint

12,000 Days of Solitude

Sweet Vermouth, lemon twist, Evan Williams Bourbon, Angostura bitters
Suggested cocktail pairing

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Well, it's Groundhog Day...again. Join us and enjoy a special three-course prix fixe menu with themed dishes and a delightful drink.

show.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
show.headline: Edgar Wright's hyper-kinetic adaptation of the cult comic

event.title: <show-title>Scott Pilgrim vs. the World</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Fourth wall-crushing epicness
event.description:
WE ARE ALAMO DRAFTHOUSE AND WE ARE HERE TO SHOW YOU AWESOME MOVIES AND HAVE FUN AND STUFF!

That’s where our SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party comes in. It’s a film of pure joy. An epic love letter to geek culture straight from the hearts of Edgar Wright and Bryan Lee O'Malley.

We love SCOTT PILGRIM. We love you. So in this spirit of love, we’ve brought back this epic of epicness in an epic way: with fourth wall-crushing props like a Scott Pilgrim inflatable bass guitar to channel your inner Scott (or Young Neil) as you jam along to the electrifying soundtrack, a 1-Up acrylic keychain, and a custom double-sided "pixelated" pressed zinc coin that you don’t even need to smash any evil exes to get – all included in your ticket.

It's the SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party and it will punch the highlights right out of your hair. Just remember, the password is “whatever”.

show.title: The Wedding Singer
show.headline: Party with Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore like it's 1985

event.title: <show-title>The Wedding Singer</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party with Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore like it's 1985
event.description:
Among several rom-coms from 1998 that grew up to become classics (YOU'VE GOT MAIL! THERE'S SOMETHING ABOUT MARY!), THE WEDDING SINGER stands out as the first (and arguably best) romantic pairing of Adam Sandler + Drew Barrymore.

Sandler plays Robbie, a burnt-out singer at weddings and bar mitzvahs who aspires to become a real musician. While working a wedding, he meets the new waitress Julia (Barrymore), who is kind, effervescent, and impossible not to love. The catch? Both Robbie and Julia are engaged to human pieces of garbage. Robbie is quickly saved from a lifetime of misery when he's left at the altar, but Julia is still head-over-heels in love with total douchebag Glenn and set on becoming Mrs. Julia Guglia. While mending a broken heart (and when he's not writing the best breakup song of all time), Robbie puts his wedding industry knowledge to good use by helping Julia plan her wedding. All their friends notice the sparks flying, but both brush it off and claim they're totally just friends. Suuuuure....

THE WEDDING SINGER features a fantastic supporting cast: Sandler's frequent collaborator Allen Covert, Christine Taylor, Ellen Albertini Dow, even Billy Idol! The soundtrack is even better: David Bowie, The Smiths, more Billy Idol, and two originals by Sandler that are quite possibly the best breakup and love songs ever made.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Sheet music
  • Squishy meatball
  • Cassette tape keychain

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine’s hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin’ tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That’s why we’re inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Sing-Along Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We’ll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, “gold” necklaces to show you’re a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Sing-Along Movie Party. You’ll be belting out all of Conner4Real’s greatest hits so loudly, it’ll be like you just opened your Aquaspin refrigerator. DOINK DE DOINK!

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in Cats scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you’ve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that’ll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We’ll have candles to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, bracelets from the Opera Ghost (or the Angel of Music, not sure which), and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

show.title: Ghost (1990)
show.headline: A love that will last forever

event.title: <show-title>Ghost (1990)</show-title>
event.headline: A classic supernatural romance film that made the world horny for pottery wheels
event.description:
“Molly, you in danger, girl.”

But then again, aren’t we all in danger at the end of the day? Despite many more pressing matters, it seems that the “danger” we often fear the most is that of loss or abandonment. How do we rebuild our lives when we’ve lost someone who shaped our existence? And how do those we’ve lost move on when they feel like they have unfinished business in this world? In Jerry Zucker’s 1990 supernatural romance film GHOST, some of these questions are asked and…kinda answered. Listen, don’t expect any huge revelations about mortality and the afterlife. This isn’t Bergman – think TWILIGHT, not THE SEVENTH SEAL. And it’s pretty damn queer!

Pretty boy Sam Wheat (Patrick Swayze) leads a charmed life with androgynous artist girlfriend Molly Jensen (Demi Moore) until a violent mugging leaves Sam dead and Molly in shambles. But there’s more – Sam is a ghost now (hence the title) and he’s determined to protect Molly from impending danger with the help of dubious medium Ode May Brown (Whoopi Goldberg). Yes, there is cross-gender body-hopping, don’t worry. Erotic pottery, a boyish hairstyle that made headlines, and an Oscar-winning performance from Goldberg turned this spectral romp into the top-grossing film of 1990. Written by queer screenwriter Bruce Joel Rubin (he also wrote JACOB'S LADDER – this dude loves metaphysics), GHOST is filled with subtextual interrogations of liminality, gender, and identity. Plus Swayze is in it, and as we’ve said before, Patrick Swayze has never made a “straight” film. Happy Valentine’s season queers. We love you! (Now you say “ditto.”)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Candyman (2021)
show.headline: Nia DaCosta's terrifying vision of an urban legend.

event.title: <show-title>Candyman (2021)</show-title>
event.headline: Nia DaCosta's terrifying vision of an urban legend.
event.description:
For as long as residents can remember, the housing projects of Chicago’s Cabrini-Green neighborhood were terrorized by a word-of-mouth ghost story about a supernatural killer with a hook for a hand, easily summoned by those daring to repeat his name five times into a mirror. In present day, a decade after the last of the Cabrini towers were torn down, visual artist Anthony McCoy (Yahya Abdul-Mateen II) and his partner, gallery director Brianna Cartwright (Teyonah Parris), move into a luxury loft condo in Cabrini, now gentrified beyond recognition and inhabited by upwardly mobile millennials.

With Anthony’s painting career on the brink of stalling, a chance encounter with a Cabrini-Green old-timer (Colman Domingo) exposes Anthony to the tragically horrific nature of the true story behind Candyman. Anxious to maintain his status in the Chicago art world, Anthony begins to explore these macabre details in his studio as fresh grist for paintings, unknowingly opening a door to a complex past that unravels his own sanity and unleashes a terrifying wave of violence that puts him on a collision course with destiny.

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Disembodied
show.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip

event.title: <show-title>Disembodied</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip
event.description:
SF: post-screening Q&A with co-star Hannah Davey

Indebted to David Lynch's ERASERHEAD, Ed Wood's PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE, and Frank Henenlotter's BRAIN DAMAGE, DISEMBODIED is a cinematic acid trip that blurs the line between horror and experimental art. The story follows Connie Sproutz, a gothed-out scientist who checks into the decrepit Grand Hotel to continue her experiments...and turn people into slime before eating them. Shot in Reno by director Willam Kersten on gritty 16mm film, this DIY passion project is filled with stop-motion effects, gory body horror, and surrealist visuals. Bleeding Skull is honored to present a 4K restoration of the original, uncut version of DISEMBODIED for the first time ever.

4K restoration courtesy of Bleeding Skull

show.title: Get Out
show.headline: Plunge back into Jordan Peele’s modern horror masterpiece.

event.title: <show-title>Get Out</show-title>
event.headline: Plunge back into Jordan Peele’s modern horror masterpiece.
event.description: Peele’s modern-day classic follows a young African-American man who goes to visit his white girlfriend’s affluent family for the first time, and as the visit progresses, he uncovers unnerving secrets about them. With an all-time performance from Daniel Kaluuya, GET OUT is one of the most influential films in horror history.

show.title: Nope (2022)
show.headline: Writer/director Jordan Peele heads west for his horror epic

event.title: <show-title>Nope (2022)</show-title>
event.headline: Jordan Peele heads west for this genre-defying adventure.
event.description:
Set on an isolated, black-owned horse ranch in California with long-running ties to Hollywood, NOPE follows James (Daniel Kaluuya, GET OUT) and Jill Haywood (Keke Palmer, HUSTLERS) as a bad miracle (a tragedy?) unfolds around them. Tormented by an unidentified flying object, they’ll have to fight for survival against a terrifying and possibly out-of-this-world enemy.

Time and again, Jordan Peele has proven himself to be an essential voice of the horror genre, telling wholly unique and chilling stories that highlight the insidious terror behind everyday issues like casual racism and our own identities. NOPE continues this trend while focusing on things like familial legacy and the fear of the unknown. Featuring a cast filled with some of the most exciting actors of color working today, including Kaluuya, Palmer, Steven Yeun, and genre stalwarts Keith David and Michael Wincott, NOPE is another shocking, witty, and visually stunning addition to Peele’s already sterling filmography.

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Us (2019)
show.headline: Tether yourself to Jordan Peele's new horror classic

event.title: <show-title>Us (2019)</show-title>
event.headline: Tether yourself to Jordan Peele's new horror classic.
event.description:
Traumatized by a childhood experience at the Santa Cruz Boardwalk, the now-grown Adelaide (Lupita N'yongo) returns to the seaside vacation town with her husband (Winston Duke) and young family, only to be beset by a murderous gang of doppelgängers. Loaded with a fierce socio-political allegory, masterful set pieces, and a thunderous central performance from N'yongo, US thankfully doesn't answer all of the questions it saliently proposes, except for one: is Jordan Peele's run as a new Master of Horror just beginning? The answer is a resounding yes. (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Crash (1996)
show.headline: David Cronenberg's erotic odyssey of sex and car crashes.

event.title: <show-title>Crash (1996)</show-title>
event.headline: David Cronenberg's erotic odyssey of sex and car crashes.
event.description:
For this icily erotic fusion of flesh and machine, David Cronenberg adapted J. G. Ballard’s future-shock novel of the 1970s into one of the most singular and provocative films of the 1990s. A traffic collision involving a disaffected commercial producer, James (James Spader), and an enigmatic doctor, Helen (Holly Hunter), brings them, along with James’s wife, Catherine (Deborah Kara Unger, in a sublimely detached performance), together in a crucible of blood and broken glass—and it’s not long before they are all initiated into a kinky, death-obsessed underworld of sadomasochistic car-crash fetishists for whom twisted metal and scar tissue are the ultimate turn-ons. Controversial from the moment it premiered at Cannes—where it won a Special Jury Prize “for originality, for daring, and for audacity”— CRASH has since taken its place as a key text of late-twentieth-century cinema, a disturbingly seductive treatise on the relationships between humanity and technology, sex and violence, that is as unsettling as it is mesmerizing. (The Criterion Collection)

4k restoration of the uncut NC-17 version courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Demonlover
show.headline: An early 21st century masterpiece from Olivier Assayas.

event.title: <show-title>Demonlover</show-title>
event.headline: An early 21st century masterpiece from Olivier Assayas.
event.description:
Olivier Assayas' (IRMA VEP, PERSONAL SHOPPER) girlboss techno-thriller ports pulp intrigue across the millennial chasm. Working to bring an anime game studio into the fold, French multinational exec Diane de Monx (Connie Nielsen) courts an American web company fronted by Elaine Si Gibril (Gina Gershon). Diane soon discovers that her partnership is not all it seems to be, descending into a dark web of deceit that presaged much of our discordant contemporary media landscape. (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Dressed to Kill (1980)
show.headline: Brian De Palma's hyper-stylized serio-comic erotic thriller.

event.title: <show-title>Dressed to Kill (1980)</show-title>
event.headline: Brian De Palma's hyper-stylized serio-comic erotic thriller.
event.description:
Brian De Palma ascended to the highest ranks of American suspense filmmaking with this virtuoso, explicit erotic thriller. At once tongue in cheek and scary as hell, DRESSED TO KILL revolves around the grisly murder of a woman in Manhattan and how her psychiatrist, her brainiac teenage son, and the prostitute who witnessed the crime try to piece together what happened while the killer remains at large. With its masterfully executed scenes of horror, voluptuous camera work, and passionate score, Dressed to Kill is a veritable symphony of terror, enhanced by vivid performances by Angie Dickinson, Michael Caine, and Nancy Allen.

DCP courtesy of Park Circus

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Frankie Freako
show.headline: An uptight yuppie calls a party hotline promising out-of-this-world fun

event.title: <show-title>Frankie Freako</show-title>
event.headline: Li'l ghouls rule in this practical VFX comic cavalcade.
event.description:
After the success of GREMLINS, the market for movies about weird li’l guys was booming. Full Moon Pictures built a direct-to-video empire exploiting that craze alone with li’l ghouls (GHOULIES), li’l dinosaurs (PREHYSTERIA), and li’l dollmen (DOLLMAN), to name a few. Writer/director Steven Kostanski (PSYCHO GOREMAN) channels that singular energy into his latest practical effect-laden opus, FRANKIE FREAKO.

It’s 1991. Vanilla yuppie Conor Sweeney is perfectly content with a hum-drum job and home life. When his comically attractive wife challenges his worldview, Conor becomes entranced by an infomercial about Frankie Freako, a rock 'n' roll goblin that promises to turn your life upside-down. What could be one joke stretched to its limits turns into a wildly inventive and expansive avenue for mile-a-minute gags and ambitious practical effects. You will have zero idea where this ride will take you. That’s the FRANKIE FREAKO promise! (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of Shout! Studios

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Boy Next Door
show.headline: J. Lo has a stalker in this ridiculous erotic thriller.

event.title: <show-title>The Boy Next Door</show-title>
event.headline: J. Lo has a stalker in this ridiculous erotic thriller.
event.description:
What do you do when you catch your husband cheating with his secretary? If you are high school teacher and attractive middle-aged mom Claire Peterson (Jennifer Lopez), you start an affair with your much younger, hot neighbor, Noah (Ryan Guzman)! What could go wrong... besides your one night stand crashing your high school literature class!

At first all seems fine. Noah befriends Claire’s son, he buys her gifts, and runs errands. However, Noah crosses the line when he begins showing up unannounced to drop double entendres at the breakfast table - "I love your mother’s cookies”.

Yet nothing really says obsession like a first edition copy of the Iliad, and Claire soon senses danger. Is is it all in her head? Is Noah stalking her? Or does he just live next door?!

Rob Cohen (THE SKULLS, THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS) directs this unhinged, campy return of the erotic thriller genre, defying all rules of logic and good taste in the process. (Jazmyne Moreno)

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Shrek
show.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told

event.title: <show-title>Shrek</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told
event.description:
When a green ogre called Shrek discovers his swamp has been "swamped" with all sorts of fairytale creatures by the scheming Lord Farquaad, Shrek sets out, with a very loud donkey by his side, to persuade Farquaad to give his swamp back. Instead, a deal is made. Farquaad, who wants to become the king, sends Shrek to rescue Princess Fiona, who is waiting for her one true love. But once they head back with Fiona, it starts to become apparent that not only does Shrek like Fiona, but Fiona is keeping something secret.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Ogre ears
  • Onion keychain
  • Eye-pop bird
  • Smell-along card

show.title: Nothing But Trouble (1991)
show.headline: Dan Aykroyd's Texas Chain Saw Massacre.

event.title: <show-title>Nothing But Trouble (1991)</show-title>
event.headline: Dan Aykroyd's Texas Chain Saw Massacre.
event.description: After running roughshod through the 1980s as one of America's leading comic stars, Dan Aykroyd cashed in those chips to deliver his only directorial effort to-date - and what an effort it is! Big city gadfly Chevy Chase attempts to woo lawyer Demi Moore with a weekend trip upstate and in the process runs afoul of the law in a backwoods township ruled by an ancient judge (Aykroyd in the first of many grotesqueries on display). Featuring an in-the-pocket double performance by John Candy and the on-screen debut of Tupac Shakur and Digital Underground, NOTHING BUT TROUBLE stands as an anarchic missing link between Tobe Hooper and Rob Zombie that surpasses all expectations and bounds of good taste. (Jake Isgar)

show.title: Wicked
show.headline: Defy gravity with the effervescent first chapter of the mega-hit musical

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
